III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12502
Section • (1) An agency shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement that includes all the following
information:
1

• (c) Services provided.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth are supposed to receive services on life skills, but the
agency does not provide this.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Former Staff was interviewed by phone on 2/27/2025. She
reported she is a former employee of Community Care
Organization. She reported the youths were not receiving life skills
training. She stated there is a life skills coach, but they will fill out
paperwork without providing the life skills education.
Youth A was interviewed by phone on 3/12/2025. He reported he
currently lives in the Balfour Independent Living home. He
stated he receives life skills education at least twice a week. He
reported receiving life skills education such as household skills
and financial education.
Youth B was interviewed by phone on 3/12/2025. He reported he
currently lives in the Balfour Independent Living home. He
reported he receives independent living skills training such as
cooking, banking, and how to apply and interview for employment.
He stated he currently has a job and does not have any concerns.
Life Skills Coach was interviewed by phone on 3/14/2025. He
reported he provides independent living skills from a set
curriculum 3-4 times per week. He stated there are times he
provides life skills education outside of the curriculum as well,
such as outings to practice life skills such as shopping and
banking. He reported the youths in the Balfour Independent Living
home regularly participate in the life skills training. He stated he
may have filled out and signed the life skills training progress
notes prior to the life skills training occurring if he was on a tight
timeframe or had a lot of paperwork to fill out, but he has never
filled out paperwork for life skills training that did not occur.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• Progress Notes completed and signed by Life Skills Coach
documenting Independent Living Skills education was
provided to Youth A on December 30 and 31 of 2024.
January 1, 2, 6, 7, 8, 9, 13, 14, 15, 16, 20, 21, 27, 28, 29,
30 of 2025 and February 3, 5, 6, 10, 11,12, 13, 14, 17, 18,
20 of 2025.
2

• Progress Notes completed and signed by Life Skills Coach
documenting Independent Living Skills education was
provided to Youth B on December 30 and 31 of 2024.
January 1, 2, 6, 7, 8, 9, 13, 14, 15, 16, 20, 21, 27, 28, 29,
30 of 2025 and February 3, 4, 6, 10, 11,12, 13, 17, 18,19,
20 of 2025.
Analysis No violation is established due to the youths living in Balfour
Independent Living home reporting receiving independent living
skills training, the Life Skills Coach reporting providing life skills
training, and documentation being present of the youths being
provided life skills training by Life Skills Coach.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504
Section • (3) An independent living home, staffed and operated by
Description the child placing agency, must be clean, safe, and
appropriate to the needs of the youth it serves.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youths are locked out of the Independent Living (IL) home and
cannot get back in.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Former Staff was interviewed by phone on 2/27/2025. She
reported she is a former employee of Community Care
Organization. She stated she was recently contacted via text
messaging by Youth A, a youth living at the Balfour Independent
Living home, stating he was locked out of the home and needed
Former Staff to let him in. Former Staff stated she reminded Youth
A she no longer works for the agency. She stated the youths do
not have keys to the home; they just pull the door closed behind
them and it locks.
Youth A was interviewed by phone on 3/12/2025. He reported he
currently lives in the Balfour Independent Living home. He stated
he has never been locked out of the home. He reported the door
is locked during the day, but the staff have keys and there is
always someone at the home who can unlock the door. He stated
he has not had to reach out to anyone to let him in.
Youth B was interviewed by phone on 3/12/2025. He reported he
currently lives in the Balfour Independent Living home. He stated
the door of the home is unlocked during the day and is only locked
after curfew. He stated the only time anyone would be locked out
is if they arrived at the home after curfew. He stated if they arrive
3

after curfew they have to be let in by a staff with keys. He reported
he has not been locked out of the house and hasn’t had to call
anyone to let him into the house.
Life Skills Coach was interviewed by phone on 3/14/2025. Life
Skills Coach reported the Balfour Independent Living home is
staffed 100% of the time. He stated there are currently two youths
in the home who leave and come back to the home at different
times. He stated the only time a youth would not be immediately
let into the home by the staff working would be if the youth arrived
at the home after curfew. In those cases, there is protocol
requiring the staff at the home to not immediately allow the youth
into the home before talking to the youth about why they broke
curfew. Life Skills Coach stated that was the only reason he could
think of that any youth might say they were ever locked out of the
home.
Analysis No violation is established as the youths living in the home
reported they are not locked out of the home.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
